In three sentences
Comments
Security is always milling about campus and if you need anything you can call anytime. Also, there are blue emergency call towers all over campus.
I'm not personally affiliated but it seems like a very close knit group of people.
There are tons of clubs to join and activities to go to.
Social events are great for meeting people and getting free stuff, which is always good.
Don't walk through the arch before you graduate or it's bad luck.
You get a good quality education for the price.
There are lots of events on campus and there are stores and restaurants all around town.
I really enjoy the dining hall and any chance I can get to go in there I pig out at the buffet.
I don't live on campus but I have been in the dorms and they seem nice.
There are some tough science based classes but it's very doable with hard work.
Study hard, and don't slack off if you feel like you are doing well.
This is a very good school. The teachers and great and the classes are challenging. I would recommend that people highly consider this school.

textAfterTable: Am learning a lot The classes are really small for the most part. I am a Pre-vet student, it's a popular major here so the classes get filled up quickly and are really full. They almost always open up another class to choose. The professors care about the students and usually have one-on-one sessions to help the students out to make sure they're getting the most out of their classes. The professors are passionate about their subjects and really know what they are talking about. Login to rate or flag the reviews Lauren from Cincinnati, OH 12/09/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 11 out of 11 people found this review useful. 3 of 72 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Prospective pre-vet students, pharmacy students, and equestrian students will be treated to the amazing and strong programs the University of Findlay has going.
